questions.question: Why were Europeans looking for an all-water route to Asia?

choices.answer: They were looking for gold.
They wanted part of the spice trade.
They wanted to colonize Asia.
They were interested in Asian culture.

questions.question: How did Columbus's failed attempt to find Asia benefit Spain?

choices.answer: The Native Americans became Spanish allies.
Columbus spread Christianity to the Americas.
The King of Portugal became indebted to Columbus and Spain.
Land claimed by Columbus led to gain of wealth and power.

questions.question: What was NOT a positive effect of the Columbian Exchange?

choices.answer: Diseases spread and killed Native Americans.
Livestock was brought to the New World.
Crops (sugar, tobacco, potatoes) were brought to Europe.
The Americas received crops such as grapes, onions, wheat.

questions.question: What was NOT a goal of European countries during the Age of Discovery?

choices.answer: Expand empires
Increase wealth
Conquer native people
Spread Christianity

questions.question: What was the main goal of Spanish missionaries?

choices.answer: to give Native Americans land to farm
to trade for gold
to teach Native Americans to read
to convert Native Americans to Christianity

questions.question: What is NOT a reason the Spanish were able to conquer the Aztecs & Incas so easily?

choices.answer: Aztecs and Incas had leaders who had no experience in war
Spanish were excellent soldiers & had superior weapons
Spanish made alliances with enemies of the Aztecs & Incas
Native Americans had no immunities to European diseases
Columbian Exchange
Northwest Passage
Triangular Trade
Spanish Missionaries

questions.question: Spain's image, navy, and power was weakened after which event?

choices.answer: Spain signed the Treaty of Tordesillas
The defeat of the Spanish Armada
Columbus sailing to the Americas
The defeat of the English Armada

questions.question: The Northwest Passage was believed to be

choices.answer: A northwest route to the Arctic Ocean
A major overland trade route to Asia
A westward water route through North America to Asia
A passage to the Aztec and Inca empire cities

questions.question: Which Viceroyalty was partially located in what is today the United States?

choices.answer: Viceroyalty of New Spain
Viceroyalty of West Indies
Viceroyalty of Peru
Viceroyalty of Central America
The water route from the Gulf of Mexico to the Pacific Ocean
A route used by sailors during the Middle Ages
An overland route from middle Europe to Asia
The middle leg of the Triangular Trade used by slave ships

questions.question: Which was NOT a reason that Spain & Portugal turned to enslaved Africans for labor?

choices.answer: Africans had immunities to European diseases.
Many Africans were experienced in farming.
Enslaved Africans would not have knowledge of the land.
Many Africans were willing to leave their homeland.

questions.question: Which is NOT true about how colonies in the Americas benefited European countries?

choices.answer: They provided raw materials for European countries.
They could grow cash crops that were sold in Europe.
Colonies served as markets for finished goods.
The Americas provided a shortcut to Asia.

questions.question: It is believed that "America" was named after which explorer?

choices.answer: Christopher Columbus
Henry Hudson
Amerigo Vespucci
Ferdinand Magellan
